body_html:
The code can be viewed at https://github.com/Response777/Tensorflow-VAEs.

The tensorflow code's generated result of conditional VAE is in Tensorflow-VAEs//misc/condition_generated_imgs/cvae-mlp-mnist/

While the PyTorch's is in Tensorflow-VAEs/PyTorch/CVAE.py/

It seems that the label can hardly influence the generated images, while in PyTorch, the code just runs smoothly.
body_text:
The code can be viewed at https://github.com/Response777/Tensorflow-VAEs.
The tensorflow code's generated result of conditional VAE is in Tensorflow-VAEs//misc/condition_generated_imgs/cvae-mlp-mnist/
While the PyTorch's is in Tensorflow-VAEs/PyTorch/CVAE.py/
It seems that the label can hardly influence the generated images, while in PyTorch, the code just runs smoothly.
body:
The code can be viewed at https://github.com/Response777/Tensorflow-VAEs.

The tensorflow code's generated result of conditional VAE is in [Tensorflow-VAEs//misc/condition_generated_imgs/cvae-mlp-mnist/](https://github.com/Response777/Tensorflow-VAEs/tree/master/misc/condition_generated_imgs/cvae-mlp-mnist)

While the PyTorch's is in [Tensorflow-VAEs/PyTorch/CVAE.py/](https://github.com/Response777/Tensorflow-VAEs/tree/master/PyTorch/CVAE.py)

It seems that the label can hardly influence the generated images, while in PyTorch, the code just runs smoothly.
